meanings.definition: Plural form of 'lusus' - a playful or capricious act or gesture
meanings.sent1: Children at the playground enjoyed creating lususes with sand and sticks.
meanings.sent2: The clown's lususes brought smiles to everyone's faces at the circus.
meanings.sent3: The lususes of the mischievous puppy kept the family entertained all day.
meanings.sent4: Her lususes of kindness were like little rays of sunshine in people's lives.
meanings.sent5: The artist's lususes on the canvas were full of vibrant colors and whimsical shapes.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'lusus naturae' - an abnormality or anomaly in nature
meanings.sent1: Scientists were amazed by the discovery of strange lususes in the deep sea.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of lususes found in different ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The farmer found lususes in his crop that made him scratch his head in wonder.
meanings.sent4: The lususes of the rock formations looked like sculptures crafted by nature itself.
meanings.sent5: The forest was full of lususes, from oddly shaped trees to colorful mushrooms.
